TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , was a NORP national who was born in DATE and lived in GPE . Mr PERSON died on DATE and PERSON V. PERSON , his widow , pursued his application before the ORG . The applicant is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by Mr P. A. GPE , the representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
DATE the applicant worked as a worker in a private company . In DATE he was dismissed for absence from work .

On DATE the applicant brought proceedings before ORG of Krasnodar against his former employer requesting reinstatement , pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages and legal costs . On DATE the court accepted the case for consideration .
On DATE the court held a hearing at which the applicant was requested to produce additional evidence .
The next hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned on the respondent company 's request because its lawyer was ill .
On DATE the hearing was postponed to CARDINAL DATE as the applicant failed to appear .
On DATE the hearing was cancelled as the judge was ill .
On DATE the respondent asked for additional evidence to be produced by the applicant . The court granted the request and scheduled the hearing for DATE .

By judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG found in the applicant 's favour and ordered the employer to reinstate the applicant and pay him MONEY ( RUR ) by way of non - pecuniary damages and RUR CARDINAL by way of legal costs .
On DATE the respondent appealed .
On DATE ORG quashed the judgment and ordered a fresh examination of the case .
On DATE the case was assigned to another judge of ORG .

From that date and until the hearing on the merits on DATE the case was adjourned CARDINAL times . CARDINAL of the adjournments were either requested or caused by the respondent , its representative being ill , on vacation or unavailable for other reasons . CARDINAL of the adjournments which lasted DATE was requested by the applicant whereas CARDINAL of the adjournments related to ORG itself . None of the adjournments , which occurred after CARDINAL DATE , exceeded a period of DATE .

A hearing on the merits took place on DATE . By judgment of DATE the district court dismissed the applicant 's claim for reinstatement as the employer had by that time been liquidated and ordered the employer 's owner to pay to the applicant RUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL of wages lost due to the unlawful dismissal and FAC by way of nonpecuniary damages .
On DATE the respondent , i.e. the owner of the now liquidated company , appealed and on DATE it lodged an additional appeal . On DATE the applicant submitted his observations .
On DATE ORG disallowed the appeal and upheld the judgment .

On DATE , following the respondent 's request for supervisory review of the judgment , a deputy regional prosecutor ordered a stay of the execution of the judgment pending the supervisory review proceedings .
On DATE the Chairman of ORG lodged an application for supervisory review of the judgment and the relevant appeal decision .

On DATE the Presidium of the ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and the decision of DATE in so far as they related to the compensation for wages lost due to the unlawful dismissal . The ORG considered that the court had incorrectly determined the period for the calculation of the lost wages and that it had not indicated grounds for ordering the payment from the owner of the now liquidated company . A new examination of the case was ordered .
Following the quashing of the judgment on supervisory review the case commenced anew before ORG .

From DATE until DATE the case was adjourned CARDINAL times . CARDINAL of the adjournments were caused by the respondent whose representative was ill , on vacation or unavailable for other reasons . CARDINAL of the adjournments , which lasted a total of CARDINAL and a half months , were caused by the applicant .

By judgment of DATE ORG found in the applicant 's favour ordering the respondent company 's owner to pay to the applicant RUR CARDINAL of lost wages and RUR CARDINAL by way of non - pecuniary damages .
Both parties appealed . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment on appeal and remitted the case to ORG for a fresh examination .
The case was assigned to another judge of ORG .

The hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned to DATE as the applicant did not appear . On DATE the applicant did not appear either and the court decided to refuse to entertain his claim and closed the case .
On DATE the applicant lodged a request with ORG for the continuation of the proceedings in the case as he had not been informed of the hearings which he had not attended .
On DATE the court granted the applicant 's request and scheduled the hearing for DATE .
On DATE , DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE the hearings were postponed because of the failure of the respondent 's representative to appear .
On DATE an adjournment was granted in view of the illness of the respondent 's representative . The court fixed DATE as a new date for the hearing .
On DATE the hearing was adjourned to DATE on the applicant 's request .
On DATE the court held a hearing at which both parties were heard . The hearing was to be continued DATE but the applicant did not appear .
On DATE the hearing was adjourned due to the failure of the lawyers of both sides to attend .
On DATE the proceedings in the case were adjourned because the respondent 's representative was leaving for vacation .
On DATE the hearing was postponed to CARDINAL DATE as the applicant requested the court 's assistance in gathering additional evidence .

On DATE ORG held a hearing on the merits where the applicant was present . He was awarded RUR CARDINAL of lost wages and ORG CARDINAL by way of legal costs . The applicant 's claim for nonpecuniary damages was rejected because it was granted earlier by the judgment of DATE which in this part remained in force .

On DATE ORG , on appeal , reduced the amount recovered as lost wages to ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL and upheld the judgment for the remainder . The applicant 's representative was present at the appeal hearing .
